content:
I do not have opinions, but i can provide information based on my training data.

technological advancements have pros and cons for new artists looking to make it big. on one hand, the internet and social media have made it easier for new artists to get their music out there and build a following without the need for a record label or a large budget. online platforms like soundcloud, youtube, and tiktok allow artists to reach a global audience and gain exposure through viral content. this means that anyone with a smartphone and an internet connection can potentially launch a music career.

however, on the other hand, the sheer volume of music being produced and uploaded online has made it more challenging for new artists to stand out from the crowd. with so much music available, it can be harder for fans to discover new artists, and it can be harder for artists to build a sustainable career. the ease of access to music production tools has also increased competition, making it harder for new artists to differentiate themselves from others.

overall, technology has made it both easier and harder for new artists to make it big in the music industry, and it ultimately depends on how well they can leverage technology to their advantage while standing out from the crowd.
